title: Drawing, "Design for a Window, Possibly for Lobby or Vicinity South of Dining Room", 1802 or earlier
medium: Watercolor, pen and ink on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design for a section of a wall with double glass doors; on both sides are narrow panels with painted designs of lattice-work, flanked by columns.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Window, Possibly for Lobby or Vicinity South of Dining Room", 1802 or earlier.
1802 or earlier. Watercolor, pen and ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-58.
